It's my understanding that the Unity engine does not support multi-threading, so it probably cannot fully utilize a dual or quad core processor. Also, it can only use 2 GB or RAM - so the only benefit you'd get from having more, of course, is for all the other stuff your machine might be running at the same time (OS, services, other applications, etc.).

Sadly, this means that most typical gamers' computers, which should have more than enough power to run this or most other games smoothly, will still experience some slowness with KSP.

it actually depends on your CPU clockspeed more...(not the # of cores)

see... Unity engine is 32bit and not multithread enabled plus the PhysX it uses is not ultilizing your GPU to do physics calculations.

i think the minimum requirements is a bit higher than it really is, i have slightly under the graphics card requirements but i still get 40+ fps with ships under 300 parts.

also, due to its style, ksp is perfectly playable at framerates that other games arent. you can go to the mun and back with 5 fps

I currently Downloading KSP v21.1 And i saw the System Requirements below. It says 4GB RAM. My Notebook has 4GB but only 3,8GB are useable.

Generally when game requirements call for "4GB RAM" they mean how much the computer actually has installed, not how much is available. You should be just fine.
Well, with some lag while looking down and near the water, KSP can work on 1.6 GB RAM, 1.4 GHZ Single core (2 fake cores) with an AMD Radeon HD 6xxx chip. So yeah, it'll surely work on your laptop.
if you lag when looking at water, go into settings.cfg, look for where is says kerbin ocean, and change all the values to 1 (should be 3 separate values under it)
